name: py-matplotlib

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: backend
variants.description: Default backend. All backends are installed and functional as long as dependencies are found at run-time

variants.name: image
variants.description: Enable reading/saving JPEG, BMP and TIFF files

variants.name: fonts
variants.description: Enable support for system font detection

description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.

dependencies.name: ffmpeg
dependencies.description:
FFmpeg is a complete, cross-platform solution to record, convert and
stream audio and video.

dependencies.name: fontconfig
dependencies.description: Fontconfig is a library for configuring/customizing font access

dependencies.name: freetype
dependencies.description:
FreeType is a freely available software library to render fonts. It is
written in C, designed to be small, efficient, highly customizable, and
portable while capable of producing high-quality output (glyph images)
of most vector and bitmap font formats.

dependencies.name: ghostscript
dependencies.description: An interpreter for the PostScript language and for PDF.

dependencies.name: imagemagick
dependencies.description:
ImageMagick is a software suite to create, edit, compose, or convert
bitmap images.

dependencies.name: libpng
dependencies.description: libpng is the official PNG reference library.

dependencies.name: pil
dependencies.description:
Pillow is a fork of the Python Imaging Library (PIL). It adds image
processing capabilities to your Python interpreter. This library
supports many file formats, and provides powerful image processing and
graphics capabilities.

dependencies.name: pkgconfig
dependencies.description:
pkg-config is a helper tool used when compiling applications and
libraries

dependencies.name: py-certifi
dependencies.description:
Certifi: A carefully curated collection of Root Certificates for
validating the trustworthiness of SSL certificates while verifying the
identity of TLS hosts.

dependencies.name: py-contourpy
dependencies.description: Python library for calculating contours of 2D quadrilateral grids.

dependencies.name: py-cycler
dependencies.description: Composable style cycles.

dependencies.name: py-fonttools
dependencies.description:
fontTools is a library for manipulating fonts, written in Python. The
project includes the TTX tool, that can convert TrueType and OpenType
fonts to and from an XML text format, which is also called TTX. It
supports TrueType, OpenType, AFM and to an extent Type 1 and some Mac-
specific formats.

dependencies.name: py-importlib-resources
dependencies.description: Read resources from Python packages

dependencies.name: py-ipykernel
dependencies.description: IPython Kernel for Jupyter

dependencies.name: py-kiwisolver
dependencies.description: A fast implementation of the Cassowary constraint solver

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-packaging
dependencies.description: Core utilities for Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pybind11
dependencies.description:
pybind11 -- Seamless operability between C++11 and Python. pybind11 is a
lightweight header-only library that exposes C++ types in Python and
vice versa, mainly to create Python bindings of existing C++ code. Its
goals and syntax are similar to the excellent Boost.Python library by
David Abrahams: to minimize boilerplate code in traditional extension
modules by inferring type information using compile-time introspection.

dependencies.name: py-pycairo
dependencies.description: Pycairo is a set of Python bindings for the cairo graphics library.

dependencies.name: py-pygobject
dependencies.description: bindings for the GLib, and GObject, to be used in Python.

dependencies.name: py-pyparsing
dependencies.description: A Python Parsing Module.

dependencies.name: py-pyqt4
dependencies.description:
PyQt is a set of Python v2 and v3 bindings for The Qt Company's Qt
application framework and runs on all platforms supported by Qt
including Windows, OS X, Linux, iOS and Android. PyQt4 supports Qt v4
and will build against Qt v5.

dependencies.name: py-pyqt5
dependencies.description:
PyQt is a set of Python v2 and v3 bindings for The Qt Company's Qt
application framework and runs on all platforms supported by Qt
including Windows, OS X, Linux, iOS and Android. PyQt5 supports Qt v5.

dependencies.name: py-pyqt6
dependencies.description: PyQt6 is a comprehensive set of Python bindings for Qt v6.

dependencies.name: py-pytest
dependencies.description: pytest: simple powerful testing with Python.

dependencies.name: py-python-dateutil
dependencies.description: Extensions to the standard Python datetime module.

dependencies.name: py-pytz
dependencies.description: World timezone definitions, modern and historical.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm
dependencies.description: The blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm-git-archive
dependencies.description:
This is a setuptools_scm plugin that adds support for git archives (for
example the ones GitHub automatically generates).

dependencies.name: py-six
dependencies.description: Python 2 and 3 compatibility utilities.

dependencies.name: py-tornado
dependencies.description: Tornado is a Python web framework and asynchronous networking library.

dependencies.name: py-wheel
dependencies.description: A built-package format for Python.

dependencies.name: py-wxpython
dependencies.description: Cross platform GUI toolkit for Python.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: qhull
dependencies.description:
Qhull computes the convex hull, Delaunay triangulation, Voronoi diagram,
halfspace intersection about a point, furt hest-site Delaunay
triangulation, and furthest-site Voronoi diagram. The source code runs
in 2-d, 3-d, 4-d, and higher dimensions. Qhull implements the Quickhull
algorithm for computing the convex hull. It handles roundoff errors from
floating point arithmetic. It computes volumes, surface areas, and
approximations to the convex hull.

dependencies.name: qt
dependencies.description: Qt is a comprehensive cross-platform C++ application framework.

dependencies.name: qt-base
dependencies.description: Qt Base (Core, Gui, Widgets, Network, ...)

dependencies.name: texlive
dependencies.description:
TeX Live is an easy (we hope) way to get up and running with the TeX
document production system. It provides a comprehensive TeX system with
binaries for most flavors of Unix, including GNU/Linux, macOS, and also
Windows. It includes all the major TeX-related programs, macro packages,
and fonts that are free software, including support for many languages
around the world.

dependencies.name: tk
dependencies.description:
Tk is a graphical user interface toolkit that takes developing desktop
applications to a higher level than conventional approaches. Tk is the
standard GUI not only for Tcl, but for many other dynamic languages, and
can produce rich, native applications that run unchanged across Windows,
Mac OS X, Linux and more.

dependent_to.name: py-dh-scikit-optimize
dependent_to.description:
A Modified version of scikit-optimize a Sequential model-based
optimization toolbox for DeepHyper. Scikit-Optimize, or skopt, is a
simple and efficient library to minimize (very) expensive and noisy
black-box functions. It implements several methods for sequential model-
based optimization. skopt aims to be accessible and easy to use in many
contexts. The library is built on top of NumPy, SciPy and Scikit-Learn.

dependent_to.name: py-pylatex
dependent_to.description: A Python library for creating LaTeX files and snippets

dependent_to.name: py-cryolobm
dependent_to.description:
The crYOLO boxmanger was written to produce annotation data for crYOLO
as deep learning based particle picking procedure for cryo electro
microscopy.

dependent_to.name: py-healpy
dependent_to.description: healpy is a Python package to handle pixelated data on the sphere.

dependent_to.name: py-pycocotools
dependent_to.description: Official APIs for the MS-COCO dataset.

dependent_to.name: py-ucsf-pyem
dependent_to.description:
UCSF pyem is a collection of Python modules and command-line utilities
for electron microscopy of biological samples.

dependent_to.name: geopm
dependent_to.description:
GEOPM is an extensible power management framework targeting HPC. The
GEOPM package provides libgeopm, libgeopmpolicy and applications
geopmctl and geopmpolicy, as well as tools for postprocessing. GEOPM is
designed to be extended for new control algorithms and new hardware
power management features via its plugin infrastructure. Note: GEOPM
interfaces with hardware using Model Specific Registers (MSRs). For
propper usage make sure MSRs are made available directly or via the msr-
safe kernel module by your administrator.

dependent_to.name: py-meautility
dependent_to.description: Python package for multi-electrode array (MEA) handling and stimulation.

dependent_to.name: py-pyvista
dependent_to.description: Easier Pythonic interface to VTK.

dependent_to.name: py-neurom
dependent_to.description: Python library neuron morphology analysis

dependent_to.name: py-rsatoolbox
dependent_to.description: Representational Similarity Analysis (RSA) in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-filterpy
dependent_to.description:
This library provides Kalman filtering and various related optimal and
non-optimal filtering software written in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-kosh
dependent_to.description:
Kosh allows codes to store, query, share data via an easy-to-use Python
API. Kosh lies on top of Sina and can use any database backend supported
by Sina. In adition Kosh aims to make data access and sharing as simple
as possible.

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-image
dependent_to.description:
Image processing algorithms for SciPy, including IO, morphology,
filtering, warping, color manipulation, object detection, etc.

dependent_to.name: draco
dependent_to.description:
Draco is an object-oriented component library geared towards numerically
intensive, radiation (particle) transport applications built for
parallel computing hardware. It consists of semi-independent packages
and a robust build system.

dependent_to.name: py-corner
dependent_to.description: Make some beautiful corner plots.

dependent_to.name: py-devito
dependent_to.description:
Devito is a Python package to implement optimized stencil computation.
(e.g., finite differences, image processing, machine learning) from
high-level symbolic problem definitions. Devito builds on SymPy and
employs automated code generation and just-in-time compilation to
execute optimized computational kernels on several computer platforms,
including CPUs, GPUs, and clusters thereof.

dependent_to.name: py-misopy
dependent_to.description:
MISO (Mixture of Isoforms) is a probabilistic framework that quantitates
the expression level of alternatively spliced genes from RNA-Seq data,
and identifies differentially regulated isoforms or exons across
samples.

dependent_to.name: professor
dependent_to.description: Professor Monte-Carlo tuning package

dependent_to.name: py-gradio
dependent_to.description:
Python library for easily interacting with trained machine learning
models

dependent_to.name: yoda
dependent_to.description: YODA - Yet more Objects for Data Analysis

dependent_to.name: py-astropy
dependent_to.description:
The Astropy Project is a community effort to develop a single core
package for Astronomy in Python and foster interoperability between
Python astronomy packages.

dependent_to.name: cryodrgn
dependent_to.description:
CryoDRGN is a neural network based algorithm for heterogeneous cryo-EM
reconstruction. In particular, the method models a continuous
distribution over 3D structures by using a neural network based
representation for the volume

dependent_to.name: py-neurotools
dependent_to.description:
A collection of tools for representing and anlyzing neuroscientific
data.

dependent_to.name: uqtk
dependent_to.description:
Sandia Uncertainty Quantification Toolkit. The UQ Toolkit (UQTk) is a
collection of libraries and tools for the quantification of uncertainty
in numerical model predictions

dependent_to.name: py-openmc
dependent_to.description:
OpenMC is a community-developed Monte Carlo neutron and photon transport
simulation code. It is capable of performing fixed source, k-eigenvalue,
and subcritical multiplication calculations on models built using either
a constructive solid geometry or CAD representation. OpenMC supports
both continuous-energy and multigroup transport. The continuous-energy
particle interaction data is based on a native HDF5 format that can be
generated from ACE files produced by NJOY. Parallelism is enabled via a
hybrid MPI and OpenMP programming model.

dependent_to.name: py-pydmd
dependent_to.description:
PyDMD is a Python package that uses Dynamic Mode Decomposition for a
data-driven model simplification based on spatiotemporal coherent
structures.

dependent_to.name: qmcpack
dependent_to.description:
QMCPACK, is a modern high-performance open-source Quantum Monte Carlo
(QMC) simulation code.

dependent_to.name: py-espressopp
dependent_to.description:
ESPResSo++ is an extensible, flexible, fast and parallel simulation
software for soft matter research. It is a highly versatile software
package for the scientific simulation and analysis of coarse-grained
atomistic or bead-spring models as they are used in soft matter research

dependent_to.name: py-py6s
dependent_to.description:
A wrapper for the 6S Radiative Transfer Model to make it easy to run
simulations with a variety of input parameters, and to produce outputs
in an easily processable form.

dependent_to.name: py-drep
dependent_to.description:
dRep is a python program for rapidly comparing large numbers of genomes.
dRep can also "de-replicate" a genome set by identifying groups of
highly similar genomes and choosing the best representative genome for
each genome set.

dependent_to.name: py-mizani
dependent_to.description:
Mizani is a scales package for graphics. It is based on Hadley Wickham's
Scales package.

dependent_to.name: py-hclust2
dependent_to.description:
Hclust2 is a handy tool for plotting heat-maps with several useful
options to produce high quality figures that can be used in publication.

dependent_to.name: py-cartopy
dependent_to.description: Cartopy - a cartographic python library with matplotlib support.

dependent_to.name: reprimand
dependent_to.description:
RePrimAnd: Recovery of Primitives And EOS framework RePrimAnd is a
support library for numerical simulations of general relativistic
magnetohydrodynamics. It provides methods for recovering primitive
variables like pressure and velocity from the variables evolved in
quasi-conservative formulations. Further, it provides a general
framework for handling matter equations of state.

dependent_to.name: py-ultralytics
dependent_to.description:
Ultralytics YOLOv8, developed by Ultralytics, is a cutting-edge, state-
of-the-art (SOTA) model that builds upon the success of previous YOLO
versions and introduces new features and improvements to further boost
performance and flexibility. YOLOv8 is designed to be fast, accurate,
and easy to use, making it an excellent choice for a wide range of
object detection, image segmentation and image classification tasks.

dependent_to.name: steps
dependent_to.description: STochastic Engine for Pathway Simulation

dependent_to.name: py-markov-clustering
dependent_to.description: Implementation of the Markov clustering (MCL) algorithm in python

dependent_to.name: py-ipympl
dependent_to.description: Matplotlib Jupyter Extension.

dependent_to.name: pism
dependent_to.description: Parallel Ice Sheet Model

dependent_to.name: py-metpy
dependent_to.description:
Collection of tools for reading, visualizing and performing calculations
with weather data.

dependent_to.name: py-openai
dependent_to.description:
The OpenAI Python library provides convenient access to the OpenAI API
from applications written in the Python language. It includes a pre-
defined set of classes for API resources that initialize themselves
dynamically from API responses which makes it compatible with a wide
range of versions of the OpenAI API.

dependent_to.name: py-neurokit2
dependent_to.description:
The Python Toolbox for Neurophysiological Signal Processing. This
package is the continuation of NeuroKit 1. It's a user-friendly package
providing easy access to advanced biosignal processing routines.
Researchers and clinicians without extensive knowledge of programming or
biomedical signal processing can analyze physiological data with only
two lines of code.

dependent_to.name: py-plotnine
dependent_to.description:
plotnine is an implementation of a grammar of graphics in Python, it is
based on ggplot2. The grammar allows users to compose plots by
explicitly mapping data to the visual objects that make up the plot.

dependent_to.name: py-mne
dependent_to.description: MNE python project for MEG and EEG data analysis.

dependent_to.name: py-mpldock
dependent_to.description: Dock matplotlib figures and other widgets.

dependent_to.name: py-antspyx
dependent_to.description: Advanced Normalization Tools in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-niworkflows
dependent_to.description: Common workflows for MRI (anatomical, functional, diffusion, etc)

dependent_to.name: survey
dependent_to.description:
Survey is a high level performance tool product from Trenza, Inc. The
survey collector/analytics framework is a new generation, high level,
lightweight multiplatform Linux tool set that targets metric collection
for high level performance analysis of applications running on both
single node and on large scale platforms, including the Cray platforms.
The collector is designed to work on sequential, MPI, OpenMP, and hybrid
codes and directly leverages several interfaces available for tools
inside current MPI implementations including: MPICH, MVAPICH, MPT, and
OpenMPI. It also supports multiple architectures and has been tested on
machines based on Intel, AMD, ARM, and IBM P8/9 processors and
integrated NVIDIA GPUs. Survey is a licensed product with the source not
openly available. To access the survey source and build with spack
please contact: Trenza Inc. via: dmont@trenzasynergy.com or
jeg@trenzasynergy.com

dependent_to.name: py-imgaug
dependent_to.description:
A library for image augmentation in machine learning experiments,
particularly convolutional neural networks. Supports the augmentation of
images, keypoints/landmarks, bounding boxes, heatmaps and segmentation
maps in a variety of different ways.

dependent_to.name: py-nc-time-axis
dependent_to.description: cftime support for matplotlib axis.

dependent_to.name: py-wcsaxes
dependent_to.description:
WCSAxes is a framework for making plots of Astronomical data in
Matplotlib.

dependent_to.name: py-igraph
dependent_to.description:
Python interface to the igraph high performance graph library, primarily
aimed at complex network research and analysis.

dependent_to.name: rnaquast
dependent_to.description:
Quality assessment of de novo transcriptome assemblies from RNA-Seq data
rnaQUAST is a tool for evaluating RNA-Seq assemblies using reference
genome and gene database. In addition, rnaQUAST is also capable of
estimating gene database coverage by raw reads and de novo quality
assessment using third-party software.

dependent_to.name: py-mlxtend
dependent_to.description:
Mlxtend (machine learning extensions) is a Python library of useful
tools for the day-to-day data science tasks.

dependent_to.name: py-wradlib
dependent_to.description:
wradlib is designed to assist you in the most important steps of
processing weather radar data. These may include: reading common data
formats, georeferencing, converting reflectivity to rainfall intensity,
identifying and correcting typical error sources (such as clutter or
attenuation) and visualising the data.

dependent_to.name: mlperf-deepcam
dependent_to.description:
PyTorch implementation for the climate segmentation benchmark, based on
the Exascale Deep Learning for Climate Analytics

dependent_to.name: py-opppy
dependent_to.description:
The Output Parse-Plot Python (OPPPY) library is a python based data
analysis library designed to extract, store, and plot information from
output and dump files generated by scientific software packages.

dependent_to.name: py-arviz
dependent_to.description:
ArviZ (pronounced "AR-vees") is a Python package for exploratory
analysis of Bayesian models. Includes functions for posterior analysis,
model checking, comparison and diagnostics.

dependent_to.name: cradl
dependent_to.description:
The CRADL proxy application captured performance metrics during
inference on data from multiphysics codes, specifically ALE
hydrodynamics codes.

dependent_to.name: py-abcpy
dependent_to.description:
ABCpy is a highly modular, scientific library for approximate Bayesian
computation (ABC) written in Python. It is designed to run all included
ABC algorithms in parallel, either using multiple cores of a single
computer or using an Apache Spark or MPI enabled cluster.

dependent_to.name: bart
dependent_to.description: BART: Toolbox for Computational Magnetic Resonance Imaging

dependent_to.name: gptune
dependent_to.description:
GPTune is an autotuning framework that relies on multitask and transfer
learnings to help solve the underlying black-box optimization problem
using Bayesian optimization methodologies.

dependent_to.name: py-neurora
dependent_to.description: A Python Toolbox for Multimodal Neural Data Representation Analysis.

dependent_to.name: py-mplhep
dependent_to.description: Matplotlib styles for HEP

dependent_to.name: py-openpmd-viewer
dependent_to.description: Python visualization tools for openPMD files

dependent_to.name: py-wordcloud
dependent_to.description: A little word cloud generator in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-nilearn
dependent_to.description: Statistical learning for neuroimaging in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-quast
dependent_to.description: Quality Assessment Tool for Genome Assemblies

dependent_to.name: py-scanpy
dependent_to.description:
Scanpy is a scalable toolkit for analyzing single-cell gene expression
data built jointly with anndata.

dependent_to.name: py-deeptools
dependent_to.description:
deepTools addresses the challenge of handling the large amounts of data
that are now routinely generated from DNA sequencing centers.

dependent_to.name: py-melissa-core
dependent_to.description:
Melissa is a file-avoiding, adaptive, fault-tolerant and elastic
framework, to run large-scale sensitivity analysis or deep-surrogate
training on supercomputers. This package builds the launcher and server
modules.

dependent_to.name: py-control
dependent_to.description:
The Python Control Systems Library is a Python module that implements
basic operations for analysis and design of feedback control systems.

dependent_to.name: py-pyomo
dependent_to.description:
Pyomo is a Python-based open-source software package that supports a
diverse set of optimization capabilities for formulating and analyzing
optimization models.

dependent_to.name: spectre
dependent_to.description:
The SpECTRE numerical relativity code. SpECTRE is an open-source code
for multi-scale, multi-physics problems in astrophysics and
gravitational physics. In the future, we hope that it can be applied to
problems across discipline boundaries in fluid dynamics, geoscience,
plasma physics, nuclear physics, and engineering. It runs at petascale
and is designed for future exascale computers. SpECTRE is being
developed in support of our collaborative Simulating eXtreme Spacetimes
(SXS) research program into the multi-messenger astrophysics of neutron
star mergers, core-collapse supernovae, and gamma-ray bursts.

dependent_to.name: py-cmocean
dependent_to.description: Colormaps for Oceanography.

dependent_to.name: py-glmsingle
dependent_to.description: A toolbox for accurate single-trial estimates in fMRI time-series data.

dependent_to.name: roary
dependent_to.description: Rapid large-scale prokaryote pan genome analysis

dependent_to.name: py-networkx
dependent_to.description:
NetworkX is a Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study
of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks.

dependent_to.name: py-bluepyefe
dependent_to.description: Blue Brain Python E-feature extraction

dependent_to.name: py-colorpy
dependent_to.description:
ColorPy is a Python package to convert physical descriptions of light -
spectra of light intensity vs. wavelength - into RGB colors that can be
drawn on a computer screen. It provides a nice set of attractive plots
that you can make of such spectra, and some other color related
functions as well.

dependent_to.name: py-metaphlan
dependent_to.description:
MetaPhlAn is a computational tool for profiling the composition of
microbial communities (Bacteria, Archaea and Eukaryotes) from
metagenomic shotgun sequencing data (i.e. not 16S) with species-level.

dependent_to.name: py-pymatgen
dependent_to.description:
Python Materials Genomics is a robust materials analysis code that
defines core object representations for structures and molecules with
support for many electronic structure codes. It is currently the core
analysis code powering the Materials Project.

dependent_to.name: py-bmtk
dependent_to.description: The Brain Modeling Toolkit

dependent_to.name: openturns
dependent_to.description:
OpenTURNS is a scientific C++ and Python library featuring an internal
data model and algorithms dedicated to the treatment of uncertainties.
The main goal of this library is to provide all functionalities needed
to treat uncertainties in studies with industrial applications. Targeted
users are all engineers who want to introduce the probabilistic
dimension in their so far deterministic studies.

dependent_to.name: py-checkm-genome
dependent_to.description:
Assess the quality of microbial genomes recovered from isolates, single
cells, and metagenomes

dependent_to.name: timemory
dependent_to.description:
Modular profiling toolkit and suite of libraries and tools for
C/C++/Fortran/CUDA/Python

dependent_to.name: py-bidscoin
dependent_to.description:
Converts and organises raw MRI data-sets according to the Brain Imaging
Data Structure (BIDS).

dependent_to.name: callflow
dependent_to.description:
CallFlow is an interactive visual analysis tool that provides a high-
level overview of CCTs together with semantic refinement operations to
progressively explore the CCTs.

dependent_to.name: py-phonopy
dependent_to.description:
Phonopy is an open source package for phonon calculations at harmonic
and quasi-harmonic levels.

dependent_to.name: yade
dependent_to.description: Yade is an free software for particle based simulations.

dependent_to.name: py-ase
dependent_to.description:
The Atomic Simulation Environment (ASE) is a set of tools and Python
modules for setting up, manipulating, running, visualizing and analyzing
atomistic simulations.

dependent_to.name: hicops
dependent_to.description:
HiCOPS is a software framework for accelerating database peptide search
workflows on supercomputers. HiCOPS provided algorithm-independent
parallelizations and optimizations can be extended into new HPC database
search algorithms or scalably accelerate the existing ones.

dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-gallery
dependent_to.description:
A `Sphinx` extension that builds an HTML version of any Python script
and puts it into an examples gallery.

dependent_to.name: py-psana
dependent_to.description: LCLS II Developement: PSAna Python.

dependent_to.name: py-geomdl
dependent_to.description: Object-oriented pure Python B-Spline and NURBS library.

dependent_to.name: py-fastai
dependent_to.description:
You can use fastai without any installation by using Google Colab. In
fact, every page of this documentation is also available as an
interactive notebook - click "Open in colab" at the top of any page to
open it (be sure to change the Colab runtime to "GPU" to have it run
fast!) See the fast.ai documentation on Using Colab for more
information.

dependent_to.name: py-pathml
dependent_to.description: An open-source toolkit for computational pathology and machine learning.

dependent_to.name: py-colorio
dependent_to.description: Tools for color research

dependent_to.name: py-pauvre
dependent_to.description: pauvre: plotting package designed for nanopore and PacBio long reads

dependent_to.name: bcftools
dependent_to.description:
BCFtools is a set of utilities that manipulate variant calls in the
Variant Call Format (VCF) and its binary counterpart BCF. All commands
work transparently with both VCFs and BCFs, both uncompressed and BGZF-
compressed.

dependent_to.name: py-geoplot
dependent_to.description:
geoplot is a high-level Python geospatial plotting library. It's an
extension to cartopy and matplotlib which makes mapping easy: like
seaborn for geospatial.

dependent_to.name: py-basemap
dependent_to.description:
The matplotlib basemap toolkit is a library for plotting 2D data on maps
in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-instrain
dependent_to.description:
inStrain is python program for analysis of co-occurring genome
populations from metagenomes that allows highly accurate genome
comparisons, analysis of coverage, microdiversity, and linkage, and
sensitive SNP detection with gene localization and synonymous non-
synonymous identification.

dependent_to.name: py-spatialist
dependent_to.description:
This package offers functionalities for user-friendly geo data
processing using GDAL and OGR.

dependent_to.name: metplus
dependent_to.description:
METplus is a verification framework that spans a wide range of temporal
(warn-on-forecast to climate) and spatial (storm to global) scales.

dependent_to.name: freecad
dependent_to.description:
FreeCAD is an open-source parametric 3D modeler made primarily to design
real-life objects of any size. Parametric modeling allows you to easily
modify your design by going back into your model history to change its
parameters.

dependent_to.name: py-lifelines
dependent_to.description:
Survival analysis was originally developed and applied heavily by the
actuarial and medical community. Its purpose was to answer *why do
events occur now versus later* under uncertainty (where *events* might
refer to deaths, disease remission, etc.). *lifelines* is a pure Python
implementation of the best parts of survival analysis.

dependent_to.name: py-igor
dependent_to.description: igor: interface for reading binary IGOR files.

dependent_to.name: py-nibetaseries
dependent_to.description: BetaSeries Correlations implemented in Nipype.

dependent_to.name: py-phylophlan
dependent_to.description:
PhyloPhlAn 3.0 is an integrated pipeline for large-scale phylogenetic
profiling of genomes and metagenomes.

dependent_to.name: py-mdanalysis
dependent_to.description:
MDAnalysis is a Python toolkit to analyze molecular dynamics
trajectories generated by a wide range of popular simulation packages
including DL_Poly, CHARMM, Amber, NAMD, LAMMPS, and Gromacs. (See the
lists of supported trajectory formats and topology formats.)

dependent_to.name: py-torchgeo
dependent_to.description:
TorchGeo: datasets, samplers, transforms, and pre-trained models for
geospatial data.

dependent_to.name: py-htseq
dependent_to.description:
HTSeq is a Python package that provides infrastructure to process data
from high-throughput sequencing assays.

dependent_to.name: py-memprof
dependent_to.description:
memprof logs and plots the memory usage of all the variables during the
execution of the decorated methods.

dependent_to.name: py-intensity-normalization
dependent_to.description: Normalize intensities of images from various MRI modalities

dependent_to.name: py-yt
dependent_to.description:
Volumetric Data Analysis yt is a python package for analyzing and
visualizing volumetric, multi-resolution data from astrophysical
simulations, radio telescopes, and a burgeoning interdisciplinary
community.

dependent_to.name: py-chainer
dependent_to.description:
Chainer is a Python-based deep learning framework aiming at
flexibility. It provides automatic differentiation APIs based on the
define-by-run approach (a.k.a. dynamic computational graphs) as well as
object-oriented high-level APIs to build and train neural networks. It
also supports CUDA/cuDNN using CuPy for high performance training and
inference.

dependent_to.name: py-cmyt
dependent_to.description: Matplotlib colormaps from the yt project !

dependent_to.name: py-arcgis
dependent_to.description: ArcGIS API for Python.

dependent_to.name: py-multi-imbalance
dependent_to.description:
Multi-class imbalance is a common problem occurring in real-world
supervised classifications tasks. While there has already been some
research on the specialized methods aiming to tackle that challenging
problem, most of them still lack coherent Python implementation that is
simple, intuitive and easy to use. multi-imbalance is a python package
tackling the problem of multi-class imbalanced datasets in machine
learnin

dependent_to.name: py-sncosmo
dependent_to.description: SNCosmo is a Python library for high-level supernova cosmology analysis.

dependent_to.name: py-anuga
dependent_to.description:
ANUGA (pronounced "AHnooGAH") is open-source software for the simulation
of the shallow water equation, in particular it can be used to model
tsunamis and floods.

dependent_to.name: py-panaroo
dependent_to.description: A Bacterial Pangenome Analysis Pipeline

dependent_to.name: py-illumina-utils
dependent_to.description:
A library and collection of scripts to work with Illumina paired-end
data (for CASAVA 1.8+).

dependent_to.name: py-copulas
dependent_to.description:
Copulas is a Python library for modeling multivariate distributions and
sampling from them using copula functions. Given a table containing
numerical data, we can use Copulas to learn the distribution and later
on generate new synthetic rows following the same statistical
properties.

dependent_to.name: py-ocp-models
dependent_to.description:
Reference implementation for the MLPerf HPC OpenCatalyst DimeNet++
benchmark

dependent_to.name: py-fitter
dependent_to.description:
fitter package provides a simple class to identify the distribution from
which a data samples is generated from. It uses 80 distributions from
Scipy and allows you to plot the results to check what is the most
probable distribution and the best parameters.

dependent_to.name: py-lvis
dependent_to.description: Python API for LVIS dataset.

dependent_to.name: spiner
dependent_to.description:
Spiner: Performance portable routines for generic, tabulated, multi-
dimensional data

dependent_to.name: py-pydv
dependent_to.description:
PDV is a 1D graphics and data analysis tool, heavily based on the ULTRA
plotting tool

dependent_to.name: py-pycortex
dependent_to.description: Python Cortical mapping software for fMRI data.

dependent_to.name: minigan
dependent_to.description:
miniGAN is a generative adversarial network code developed as part of
the Exascale Computing Project's (ECP) ExaLearn project at Sandia
National Laboratories.

dependent_to.name: py-localcider
dependent_to.description: Tools for calculating sequence properties of disordered proteins

dependent_to.name: py-mpld3
dependent_to.description:
An interactive D3js-based viewer which brings matplotlib graphics to the
browser.

dependent_to.name: py-seaborn
dependent_to.description:
Seaborn: statistical data visualization. Seaborn is a library for making
attractive and informative statistical graphics in Python. It is built
on top of matplotlib and tightly integrated with the PyData stack,
including support for numpy and pandas data structures and statistical
routines from scipy and statsmodels.

dependent_to.name: possvm
dependent_to.description:
Possvm (Phylogenetic Ortholog Sorting with Species oVerlap and MCL) is a
python tool to analyse pre-computed gene trees and identify pairs and
clusters of orthologous genes. It takes advantage of the species overlap
algorithm implemented in the ETE toolkit to parse the phylogeny and
identify orthologous gene pairs, and MCL clustering for orthogroup
identification.

dependent_to.name: py-topiary-asr
dependent_to.description: Python framework for doing ancestral sequence reconstruction.

dependent_to.name: py-cma
dependent_to.description:
Python implementation of CMA-ES Covariance Matrix Adaptation Evolution
Str ategy for non-linear numerical optimization in Python

dependent_to.name: parsec
dependent_to.description:
PaRSEC: the Parallel Runtime Scheduler and Execution Controller PaRSEC
is a runtime and a programming toolbox that support the design and
parallel execution of micro-tasks on distributed, heterogeneous systems.

dependent_to.name: py-darshan
dependent_to.description:
Python utilities to interact with Darshan log records of HPC
applications.

dependent_to.name: py-salib
dependent_to.description: Python implementations of commonly used sensitivity analysis methods.

dependent_to.name: py-matplotlib-inline
dependent_to.description: Inline Matplotlib backend for Jupyter.

dependent_to.name: py-wxmplot
dependent_to.description: wxPython plotting widgets using matplotlib.

dependent_to.name: py-matplotlib-scalebar
dependent_to.description:
Provides a new artist for matplotlib to display a scale bar, aka micron
bar.

dependent_to.name: py-hist
dependent_to.description: Hist classes and utilities

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-learn
dependent_to.description: A set of python modules for machine learning and data mining.

dependent_to.name: py-contextily
dependent_to.description: Context geo-tiles in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-xgboost
dependent_to.description:
XGBoost is an optimized distributed gradient boosting library designed
to be highly efficient, flexible and portable.

dependent_to.name: py-python-picard
dependent_to.description: Preconditoned ICA for Real Data.

dependent_to.name: py-umi-tools
dependent_to.description: Tools for handling Unique Molecular Identifiers in NGS data sets

dependent_to.name: py-coclust
dependent_to.description:
Coclust provides both a Python package which implements several diagonal
and non-diagonal co-clustering algorithms, and a ready to use script to
perform co- clustering

dependent_to.name: py-pyugrid
dependent_to.description: Work with triangular unstructured grids and the data on them.

dependent_to.name: py-multiqc
dependent_to.description:
MultiQC is a tool to aggregate bioinformatics results across many
samples into a single report. It is written in Python and contains
modules for a large number of common bioinformatics tools.

dependent_to.name: py-brian
dependent_to.description: A clock-driven simulator for spiking neural networks

dependent_to.name: prmon
dependent_to.description: Standalone monitor for process resource consumption.

dependent_to.name: py-pyani
dependent_to.description:
pyani is a Python3 module that provides support for calculating average
nucleotide identity (ANI) and related measures for whole genome
comparisons, and rendering relevant graphical summary output. Where
available, it takes advantage of multicore systems, and can integrate
with SGE/OGE-type job schedulers for the sequence comparisons.

dependent_to.name: py-pycbc
dependent_to.description:
PyCBC is a software package used to explore astrophysical sources of
gravitational waves. It contains algorithms to analyze gravitational-
wave data from the LIGO and Virgo detectors, detect coalescing compact
binaries, and measure the astrophysical parameters of detected sources.
PyCBC was used in the first direct detection of gravitational waves and
is used in the flagship analysis of LIGO and Virgo data.

dependent_to.name: py-pypulse
dependent_to.description:
Pulse is a package used to handle PSRFITS files and perform subsequent
analyses on pulse profiles.

dependent_to.name: py-graphcast
dependent_to.description: GraphCast: Learning skillful medium-range global weather forecasting.

dependent_to.name: py-cinemasci
dependent_to.description: A set of python tools for reading, writing and viewing Cinema databases

dependent_to.name: py-pysurfer
dependent_to.description: Cortical neuroimaging visualization in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-gluoncv
dependent_to.description:
GluonCV provides implementations of state-of-the-art (SOTA) deep
learning algorithms in computer vision. It aims to help engineers,
researchers, and students quickly prototype products, validate new ideas
and learn computer vision.

dependent_to.name: py-vcf-kit
dependent_to.description:
VCF-kit is a command-line based collection of utilities for performing
analysis on Variant Call Format (VCF) files.

dependent_to.name: amr-wind
dependent_to.description:
AMR-Wind is a massively parallel, block-structured adaptive-mesh,
incompressible flow sover for wind turbine and wind farm simulations.

dependent_to.name: py-soyclustering
dependent_to.description:
This package is implementation of Improving spherical k-means for
document clustering. Fast initialization, sparse centroid projection,
and efficient cluster labeling (Kim et al., 2020).

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-optimize
dependent_to.description:
Scikit-Optimize, or skopt, is a simple and efficient library to minimize
(very) expensive and noisy black-box functions. It implements several
methods for sequential model-based optimization. skopt aims to be
accessible and easy to use in many contexts. The library is built on top
of NumPy, SciPy and Scikit-Learn.

dependent_to.name: py-dadi
dependent_to.description:
Fit population genetic models of demography and selection using
diffusion approximations to the allele frequency spectrum

dependent_to.name: py-abipy
dependent_to.description: Python package to automate ABINIT calculations and analyze the results.

dependent_to.name: shapemapper
dependent_to.description:
ShapeMapper automates the calculation of RNA structure probing
reactivities from mutational profiling (MaP) experiments, in which
chemical adducts on RNA are detected as internal mutations in cDNA
through reverse transcription and read out by massively parallel
sequencing.

dependent_to.name: py-roifile
dependent_to.description: Roifile is a Python library to read, write, create, and plot ImageJ ROIs

dependent_to.name: gatetools
dependent_to.description: Python tools for GATE, see https://github.com/OpenGATE/Gate

dependent_to.name: py-pygps
dependent_to.description:
pyGPs is a Python library for Gaussian Process (GP) Regression and
Classification.

dependent_to.name: paraview
dependent_to.description:
ParaView is an open-source, multi-platform data analysis and
visualization application. This package includes the Catalyst in-situ
library for versions 5.7 and greater, otherwise use the catalyst
package.

dependent_to.name: py-elephant
dependent_to.description: Elephant is a package for analysis of electrophysiology data in Python

dependent_to.name: sourmash
dependent_to.description:
Sourmash: Quickly search, compare, and analyze genomic and metagenomic
data sets with k-mer sketches.

dependent_to.name: py-descartes
dependent_to.description:
Use Shapely or GeoJSON-like geometric objects as matplotlib paths and
patches

dependent_to.name: py-heat
dependent_to.description:
Heat is a flexible and seamless open-source software for high
performance data analytics and machine learning. It provides highly
optimized algorithms and data structures for tensor computations using
CPUs, GPUs and distributed cluster systems on top of MPI.

dependent_to.name: py-pynucleus
dependent_to.description:
PyNucleus is a finite element code that specifically targets nonlocal
operators.

dependent_to.name: py-hatchet
dependent_to.description:
Hatchet is a performance tool for analyzing hierarchical performance
data using a graph-indexed Pandas dataframe.

dependent_to.name: py-carputils
dependent_to.description:
The carputils framework for running simulations with the openCARP
software.

dependent_to.name: py-phydms
dependent_to.description:
phydms enables phylogenetic analyses using deep mutational scanning data
to inform the substitution models. It implements Experimentally informed
codon models (ExpCM) for phylogenetic inference and the detection of
biologically interesting selection.

dependent_to.name: cosmomc
dependent_to.description:
CosmoMC is a Fortran 2008 Markov-Chain Monte-Carlo (MCMC) engine for
exploring cosmological parameter space, together with Fortran and python
code for analysing Monte-Carlo samples and importance sampling (plus a
suite of scripts for building grids of runs, plotting and presenting
results).

dependent_to.name: vapor
dependent_to.description:
VAPOR is the Visualization and Analysis Platform for Ocean, Atmosphere,
and Solar Researchers. VAPOR provides an interactive 3D visualization
environment that can also produce animations and still frame images.

dependent_to.name: py-currentscape
dependent_to.description: Module to easily plot the currents in electrical neuron models.

dependent_to.name: py-convokit
dependent_to.description:
This toolkit contains tools to extract conversational features and
analyze social phenomena in conversations, using a single unified
interface inspired by (and compatible with) scikit-learn.

dependent_to.name: py-damask
dependent_to.description: Pre- and post-processing tools for DAMASK

dependent_to.name: py-yahmm
dependent_to.description: YAHMM is a HMM package for Python, implemented in Cython for speed.

dependent_to.name: py-sfepy
dependent_to.description:
SfePy (https://sfepy.org/) is a software for solving systems of coupled
partial differential equations (PDEs) by the finite element method in
1D, 2D and 3D. It can be viewed both as black-box PDE solver, and as a
Python package which can be used for building custom applications.

dependent_to.name: py-netpyne
dependent_to.description:
Netpyne: A python package to facilitate the development, parallel
simulation, optimization and analysis of multiscale biological neuronal
networks in NEURON.

dependent_to.name: py-gpy
dependent_to.description: The Gaussian Process Toolbox.

dependent_to.name: py-postcactus
dependent_to.description:
This repository contains a Python package named PostCactus for
postprocessing data from numerical simulations performed with the
Einstein Toolkit.

dependent_to.name: py-continuum
dependent_to.description: A clean and simple data loading library for Continual Learning

dependent_to.name: py-mlflow
dependent_to.description: MLflow: A Platform for ML Development and Productionization.

dependent_to.name: candle-benchmarks
dependent_to.description: ECP-CANDLE Benchmarks

dependent_to.name: py-arm-pyart
dependent_to.description:
Python ARM Radar Toolkit. A growing collection of weather radar
algorithms and utilities build on top of the Scientific Python stack and
distributed under the 3-Clause BSD license. Py-ART is used by the
Atmospheric Radiation Measurement (ARM) Climate Research Facility for
working with data from a number of precipitation and cloud radars, but
has been designed so that it can be used by others in the radar and
atmospheric communities to examine, processes, and analyse data from
many types of weather radars.

dependent_to.name: py-wub
dependent_to.description:
Bioinformatics tools and a software library developed by the Oxford
Nanopore Technologies Applications group.
